name: Katja House
description:
The Katja House is a testament to what a united community can achieve. This two-story home, self-built by its promoter with the crucial help of volunteers and students from carpentry, plastering, and bioconstruction workshops, embodies the essence of the circular economy and collective learning.
Its intelligent design combines a main volume with a gable roof and an intercepted tower with a green roof, creating a distinctive and bioclimatic profile. The strategically oriented terrace provides a protected space for enjoyment throughout all seasons.
More than a house, it is a legacy of shared knowledge.
Every clay plaster and every wooden beam tells the story of the hands that built it, transforming collaborative effort into a tangible and sustainable home.
